results.title: Strength training for sport
results.creator_credit: Paul Foxall, Elizabeth Isaacs and Dan Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Sports training film series”
The explosion of new athletic records has largely come about through strength training. The training program must strengthen all muscle groups. The various strength training techniques and exercises are demonstrated by top athletes.

results.title: Fitness for sport
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Sports training film series”.
This film shows how to attain the basic physical fitness which all sportsmen need for success - whatever their sport. More than fifty exercises are demonstrated and a squad of athletes is taken through a training session devised by a former Polish Olympic athlete to develop mobility, elastic strength and endurance. Written and narrated by Ron Pickering.

results.title: Athletics: the triple jump
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Sports training film series”.
Performances by international athletes Frank Attoh, Nat Augustin, Barbara Clarke, Reynold Edwards, Kim Hagger, Colin Mitchell and Daley Thompson are used to demonstrate and analyse the basic techniques of the triple jump. Narrated by Ron Pickering.
results.description:
Episode of Series “Sports training film series”.

results.title: Athletics: the sprint
results.creator_credit: Colin Moffat, Elizabeth Isaacs, Guardian Royal Exchange Assurance and Dan Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Sports training film series”.
One of a series of athletics training films. Looks at the sprinter with particular emphasis given to the development of running skills and starting from the blocks. Narrated by Ron Pickering.

results.title: Athletics: hurdles
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Sports training film series”.
Looks at high hurdling and 400 metre hurdles and shows, at normal speed and in slow motion, the basic actions of hurdling as demonstrated in relay matches between Oxford and Cambridge. Narrated by Ron Pickering.
results.description:
Episode of Series “Sports training film series”.
Looks at high hurdling and 400 metre hurdles and shows, at normal speed and in slow motion, the basic actions of hurdling as demonstrated in relay matches between Oxford and Cambridge. Narrated by Ron Pickering.

results.title: At your service
results.brief_description: This film demonstrates the process of the manufacture of ball bearings by the famous Swedish firm of S.K.F. The firm has its own mines and steel works and carries the manufacturing processes right through to the finished product. For commercial uses some 8,000 different types and sizes are produced, in addition special precision ball bearings with an accuracy to 1,000,000 in. are produced for use in precision instruments.

results.title: At the turn of the age: Hans Holbein the younger 1497-1543
results.creator_credit: Herbert E. Meyer, Walter Leckebusch and Filmstudio Walter Leckebusch
results.brief_description: Deals with aspects of the Renaissance and concentrates on the development of Holbein’s painting, drawing and etching. Holbein, a court painter, and a prime example of the new breed of man who could move out of the restrictive boundaries of his homeland to achieve fame and wealth in foreign courts and cities.
results.title_for_label: At the turn of the age: Hans Holbein the younger 1497-1543

results.title: At the threshold of eternity
results.creator_credit: Mikel Way and Colorado State University Production Company
results.brief_description: Dr. James Enderson talks about the ways being used to save endangered or threatened wildlife. The following recovery plans: Habitat Management, Transplanting, and Captive Breeding, are shown in practice with wildlife in several areas of the United States.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Mikel Way and Colorado State University Production Company
